description: Replacement of the existing 15-metre monopole and ground-based equipment cabinets with a 20-metre monopole supporting 12 No. antenna apertures, ground-based equipment cabinets and development ancillary thereto
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s):   002/Issue B; 100/Issue B; 150/Issue B; 215/ Issue B and 265/ Issue B

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The existing equipment to be replaced shall be removed from the site within 3 months from the date that the hereby approved equipment is installed.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The hereby approved telecommunications equipment shall be removed from the site when it becomes redundant.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Notwithstanding the hereby approved plans listed in Condition 2 and the submitted documents, the hereby approved ground-based equipment cabinets shall be painted fir green and the hereby approved monopole shall be painted light grey.

Reason:  To assimilate the site into its surroundings and to protect visual amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
